Package cscd212classes.lab4

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd212classes.lab4.User
  • public final class User
extends java.lang.Object
    A Singleton for user input
    Singleton Design Pattern Website
    See Also:
    Agent, Player, Map, ConsoleColors, Display, Raylib.GetMouseX(), Raylib.GetMouseY(), Raylib.IsMouseButtonPressed(int)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Display display
      The Display Object which has a variety of helpful methods for drawing and updating the Map
      private boolean isMoving
      boolean (flag) which represents if an agent (player) is currently moving to a new location
      private Agent lastClickedAgent
      The Agent that was last clicked by the user
      private Map map
      The Map which contains the state of all the Agents
      private static User user
      The only instance of User

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void checkAndRunAbilityButton()
      Checks if the Ability button (options button on the right) was pressed and that lastClickedAgent is a Player and if so, uses that player's special ability (see Player.useSpecialAbility().
      private void checkAndRunMoveButton​(int[] mapXandY)
      Takes an int array representing x and y coordinates on the Map, checks if the Move button (options button on the left) was pressed and if the lastClickedAgent is a Player, moves the Player to the given coordinates (see Agent.move(int, int).
      static User getUser()
      This method returns the instance of this User if it exists, if it does not exist (i.e, this.user == null) throws an IllegalStateException.

      Returns the instance of this User if it exists, or creates and returns a new User if it does not (i.e, if this.user == null).
      static User getUser​(Display display, Map map)
      Returns the instance of this User if it exists, or creates and returns a new User if it does not (i.e, if this.user == null).
      void getUserInput()
      This method checks to see if the mouse button is pressed and if so, updates the state of the game by calling this.updateLastClickedAgent(), this.updateInfoBoxWithAgentInfo(), this.checkAndRunMoveButton(mapXandY), this.checkAndRunAbilityButton(), and this.map.updateAgents().
      void setMap​(Map map)
      Sets the map of this User to the passed Map object.
      private void updateInfoBoxWithAgentInfo()
      Updates Info Box Message with lastClickedAgent Class.getSimpleName() and (" : ") Agent.toString()

      private void updateLastClickedAgent​(int[] mapXandY)
      Takes an int array representing x and y coordinates on the Map and if there is an Agent at that location, updates lastClickedAgent to be that Agent.

      • User

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        public static User getUser()
        This method returns the instance of this User if it exists, if it does not exist (i.e, this.user == null) throws an IllegalStateException.
        Returns:
        A User object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - with "No User Exist" when the User class has not been made

      • getUser

        public static User getUser​(Display display)
        Returns the instance of this User if it exists, or creates and returns a new User if it does not (i.e, if this.user == null). If the User already exists, no changes are made to the user (i.e, the Display is not changed). If the User does not exist, a new user is made with the passed Display object and a warning is printed to the console indicating that the map needs to be set.

        - Check if the User already exists
        - - If the user does not exist:
        - - - - 1) make new User and store its reference in this.user
        - - - - 2) give the following warning:
        ConsoleColors.RED + "Warning: map need to be set for User" + ConsoleColors.RESET

        Return the user
        Parameters:
        display - - the Display object to be used in creation of the new User if the user does not already exist
        Returns:
        The instance of User

      • getUser

        public static User getUser​(Display display,
                           Map map)
        Returns the instance of this User if it exists, or creates and returns a new User if it does not (i.e, if this.user == null). If the User already exists, no changes are made to the user (i.e, the Display and Map are not changed). If the User does not exist, a new User is created with the passed Display and Map objects.


        - Check if the User already exists
        - - If the user does not exist:
        - - - - 1) make new User and store its reference in this.user
        - - - - 2) set this User's map to be map

        Return the user
        Parameters:
        display - - the Display helper object to be used in creation of the new User if the user does not already exist.
        map - - the Map to be used in creation of the new User if the user does not already exist.
        Returns:
        The instance of User

      • setMap

        public void setMap​(Map map)
        Sets the map of this User to the passed Map object.
        Parameters:
        map - - the new Map
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when map is null

      • getUserInput

        public void getUserInput()
        This method checks to see if the mouse button is pressed and if so, updates the state of the game by calling this.updateLastClickedAgent(), this.updateInfoBoxWithAgentInfo(), this.checkAndRunMoveButton(mapXandY), this.checkAndRunAbilityButton(), and this.map.updateAgents().

        Check to see if the mouse button is currently pressed.
        - - (see Raylib.IsMouseButtonPressed(int))
        - - If the mouse button is currently pressed:
        - - - 1) Get the X and Y coordinates that represent where the mouse pointer is located on the Map
        - - - - (Tip: look at Display.getMapXY(int, int))
        - - - 2) Call the 4 update functions this.updateLastClickedAgent(), this.updateInfoBoxWithAgentInfo(), this.checkAndRunMoveButton(mapXandY), this.checkAndRunAbilityButton(), and this.map.updateAgents()
        NOTE:
        Raylib.GetMouseX() is the X coordinate that the mouse is at on the screen, Raylib.GetMouseY() is the Y coordinate that the mouse is at on the screen, Display.getMapXY(int, int) converts the x and y coordinates from screen coordinates to map coordinates

      • updateLastClickedAgent

        private void updateLastClickedAgent​(int[] mapXandY)
        Takes an int array representing x and y coordinates on the Map and if there is an Agent at that location, updates lastClickedAgent to be that Agent. If there is not an Agent at that location, lastClickedAgent is not changed.
        Parameters:
        mapXandY - int array of size 2 representing x and y coordinates
        See Also:
        Map.isInMap(int, int), Map.getAgent(int, int)
        NOTE:
        tip make a temp Agent to store the Agent at location (x,y)

      • checkAndRunAbilityButton

        private void checkAndRunAbilityButton()
        Checks if the Ability button (options button on the right) was pressed and that lastClickedAgent is a Player and if so, uses that player's special ability (see Player.useSpecialAbility().

        If the ability fails, the info box is set to the following String: this.lastClickedAgent.getName() + " was not able to use special Ability"
        This method only works for Player, if another Agent is the lastClickedAgent, nothing will happen.
        See Also:
        Display.isInOptionsButtonRight(int, int), Player.useSpecialAbility(), Display.setInfoBoxMessage(String)

      • checkAndRunMoveButton

        private void checkAndRunMoveButton​(int[] mapXandY)
        Takes an int array representing x and y coordinates on the Map, checks if the Move button (options button on the left) was pressed and if the lastClickedAgent is a Player, moves the Player to the given coordinates (see Agent.move(int, int).

        Parameters:
        mapXandY - Map x and y as int array of size 2
        See Also:
        Map.isInMap(int, int), Map.getAgent(int, int), Agent.move(int, int), Display.isInOptionsButtonLeft(int, int), Display.setInfoBoxMessage(String)

      • updateInfoBoxWithAgentInfo

        private void updateInfoBoxWithAgentInfo()
        Updates Info Box Message with lastClickedAgent Class.getSimpleName() and (" : ") Agent.toString()
        if lastClickedAgent is null then it updates the info box message to be "Info : empty"
        See Also:
        Display.setInfoBoxMessage(String)
